intro: Lessingianthus laevigatus, commonly known as the smoothleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow ray florets and a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for both ornamental gardening and ecological studies.
